III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The one story building consists of 18,500 square feet, with half of it dedicated to a
residential treatment facility and the other half an out-patient clinic. The residential
treatment facility has twelve single occupied bedrooms, numerous bathrooms (one
with a specialized bathtub), two living rooms, a den, commercial kitchen and dining
room, a teaching kitchen, one classroom (that can be partitioned off), observation
rooms, individual treatment rooms, a medical examination room, gymnasium, a soft
room, and a waiting room. It is a state-of-art building with state-of-art equipment.
B. Program Description
The residential treatment facility serves youth ages seven to seventeen. This facility
is designed to treat youth with extremely challenging behaviors. Types of behaviors
that these youth may engage in are self-injurious behavior, serious aggression
towards persons they live with, and property destruction. Types of interventions
include reduction of problematic behaviors, building socially acceptable self-care,
social, and academic behaviors, and family training in order to be able to return the
youth to their family settings. Evidence based treatment interventions include
applied behavior analysis, direct instructions, and precision teaching. The
approximately thirty-eight employees are credentialed behavior analysts. These
employees will work closely with facility and students from Western Michigan

University in the assessment, treatment, and research regarding the behaviors of
these youth.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
None.

I recommend the issuance of an original license.
